Class: viewModel

viewModel

new viewModel()

This is the viewModel class. It handles click events, search and filtering, and instantiate Map and Foursquare objects
Properties:
Name Type Description
search_box KO.observable Linked to HTML text field
search_desc_checkbox KO.observable Linked to HTML checkbox
filteredPlaces KO.computed Contains the filtered model, computed automatically based on search fields
msg_filter_result KO.computed Message with # of records found. It is updated dynamically
Source:
  • src/js/views.js, line 20

Methods

<private, static> filter_fn(model_instance, search text, search checkbox) → {Boolean}

This function manages the search functionality, filtering the model according to the checkbox and the search field (both are ko.observables)
Parameters:
Name Type Argument Default Description
model_instance Object Item of the model to be searched
search text string <optional>
 HTML field ko.observable "search_box"
search checkbox string <optional>
 HTML checkbox ko.observable "search_desc_checkbox"

Initialize Map object, apply KO bindings and set up slim scroll (if needed)
Source:
  • src/js/views.js, line 55
Returns:
Type
None

sidebar_click(element_data, element_clicked) → {None}

This function is called by the HTML in response to click events on each sidebar destination The id of the clicked element is obtained, and then we populate the description box/image and search for this destination's address on Google Maps. If the destination is found, search on Foursquare, and store results on `fsq` property. Updates:
  • HTML - Description image
  • HTML - Description text
  • Calls Map.createMarker to create a marker with foursquare info
Parameters:
Name Type Description
element_data Object Not used. Default value passed by KO
element_clicked Object Contains the Event object of the object clicked
Source:
  • src/js/views.js, line 113
Returns:
Doesn't return anything, but updates HTML and creates marker
Type
None
